title: BBC Local Live: Beds, Herts & Bucks - BBC News
summary: bedfordshire police 's overtime bill has gone up by 50 % in the last three years partly due to gaps in recruitment .
a woman in her 60s is taken to hospital with head and neck injuries after being attacked by a cow in bedford .
firefighters use sandbags and water booms to protect homes from flooding after a water main burst in high wycombe last night .
the duke of kent visits bletchley park to officially open a new exhibition telling the story of codebreaking in world war one .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: have a good evening
text: we 're calling it a day here on local live in the three counties , but we 'll be back in the morning from 08:00 .
here are some of the top stories from today :

documents.title: mayor of watford given role on front bench
text: the mayor of watford , dorothy thornhill , has been given a role in the liberal democrat front bench .
she 's been handed the portfolio for local government .
following the general election when only eight lib dems got a seat in the commons , other members of the party have been brought in to be spokesmen and women for various areas of policy .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: death 'not sus in leighton buzzard
text: a man 's death is not being treated as sus after he was hit by a train at leighton buzzard station this morning , police say .
british transport police ( btp ) were called to the station at about 06:40 along with bedfordshire police and the ambulance service - the man was pronounced dead at the scene .
`` officers are now working to identify him and inform his family '' , a spokesman for the btp said .
`` a file will be prepared for the coroner . ''
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: high wycombe burst water main : work going well
text: work to fix and clear kingsmead road , high wycombe after a water main burst overnight is `` progressing well '' , thames water say .
the water company closed the road today between the rugby club and at the junction with dolphin court , which should be re-opened this evening once the work to clear mud and silt is completed .
debris had been washed into the road from a nearby woodland area after a 12-inch diameter water pipe burst last night .
thames water say no water supplies have been affected .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: a warmer day tomorrow
text: some sharp showers continuing at first tonight before gradually fading .
feeling cooler in a lighter northwest wind with some clear spells , temperatures falling to 6c ( 42f ) in rural areas .
tomorrow : another day of sunny spells and scattered showers is expected .
most of the showers will be in the afternoon with perhaps the odd heavier one around , although with lighter winds it will feel warmer .
maximum temperature : 19c ( 66f ) .
author: Alina Jenkins
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: missing luton 10-year-old found
text: missing 10-year-old gabriel silvera from luton has been found safe and well .
bedfordshire police
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: anti-pee paint in san francisco : an idea for hitchin ?
text: we 've done a couple updates today and yesterday about the ongoing problem of

well , i thought this was rather relevant and perhaps a good idea for the hertfordshire town - in san francisco , `` anti-pee paint '' is being trialled , which causes urine to splash back on offenders .
this report in
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: if you 're just catching up
text: the top stories this evening :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: ten-year-old missing in luton
text: a 10-year-old boy has gone missing from the marsh farm area of luton this afternoon .
gabriel silvera ( was last seen at about 14:30 in alder crescent .
his family reported him missing at 15:30 .
police are carrying out a search , but are appealing for any information or anyone who may have seen gabriel to contact them immediately on 101 .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: harvest time in the countryside
text: east herts rural police
harvest is upon us , take care on the lanes .
large items of machinery will be using the roads for the next few weeks .

documents.title: no links between crime and blacked-out streetlights
text: it happens in hertfordshire and having spoken about it in the past , we know that not everyone likes it - switching off streetlights overnight .
some critics thinks it 's just not safe , but new research say switching the streetlights off does not increase road casualties or crime .

terry douris , hertfordshire county council 's cabinet member for highways , told me : `` although we accept that there 's always the fear or crime or accidents when the lights are off , there are no figures to substantiate that .
i think that crime has probably decreased overnight . ''
author: Roberto Perrone
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: bucks driver talks about calais delays
text: a truck driver from buckinghamshire has spent the night waiting to cross the channel on the m20 in kent as police are investigating the death of a man who was killed as 1,500 migrants tried to storm the channel tunnel in calais last night .
cabinet ministers are holding an emergency meeting this morning and eurotunnel has warned of further delays
`` i have n't got much [ compassion ] to be honest .
there 's choices you make in life , '' vince steptoe told
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: the news so far
text: the top stories this afternoon :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: roads looking busy
text: roads are beginning to look busy across the three counties this afternoon .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: woman dies after m1 crash
text: a woman from bedford was killed in this morning 's five vehicle crash on the m1 , police say .
four cars and a lorry collided on the northbound carriageway just south of the milton keynes turn at 07:55 .
three other people were taken to hospital with minor injuries .
a man 's been arrested on sus of causing death by dangerous driving .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: world war one had codebreakers too
text: the history of codebreaking during world war two has been well documented at bletchley park in recent years , but today 's visit to bletchley park by the duke of kent highlights the secret war being fought behind the scenes in london during world war one .
the duke officially opened
research co-ordinator sarah relph said : `` both allies and central powers used cable and wireless telegraphy to intercept messages and deduce enemy tactics and positions .
each side tried to break the other 's codes and gain valuable intelligence . ''
author: Katy Lewis
Beds, Herts and Bucks Live

documents.title: hitchin lavender fields
text: the main image on local live today is a lovely photograph of the lavender fields in hitchin .
do you have a striking image to share of somewhere in beds , herts or bucks ?
i 'd love to feature it here on the bbc website - you can get in touch with me
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: woman attacked by cow in bedfordshire
text: a woman has been taken to hospital today after being attacked by a cow in clapham , bedfordshire .
the east of england ambulance service were called to green lane , just before 11:30 where they treated a woman believed to be in her 60s .
the woman suffered injuries to her head and neck , but they are not believed to be life-threatening or serious .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: in flooding after water main bursts in bucks
text: twelve houses were flooded after a burst water main caused
author: Bucks Free Press

documents.title: weather : showers may get heavy
text: many of us will see some sunshine this afternoon , but the odd shower may develop , and these could become heavy during the afternoon and evening .
it will feel pleasant in the sunshine with a maximum temperature of 19c ( 66f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: first test wicket in two years for finn
text: hertfordshire fast bowler steven finn has taken his first wickets in test cricket for two years , dismissing australian batsmen steven smith and michael clarke at edgbaston .
finn , who was recalled by england for the third ashes test to replace the injured mark wood , made his last appearance was against australia in nottingham in 2013 .
you can get live reports from the match on
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: traffic delays clearing
text: traffic has returned to normal on the m1 northbound after an earlier accident between a lorry and four cars at j14 for milton keynes .
there is still some
no delays reported on the trains .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: twitter `` milking '' escaped herts cows story
text: police have herded 40 cows back into their field between walkern and benington this afternoon after they managed to break free and took a leisurely stroll along the road .
a fair few jokes bandied about on twitter describe the incident as `` udderly terrible '' and having a `` moooovelous result '' .
east herts rural police
it 's fair to say so many people are committing crimes against `` gags '' with their poor cow comments , totally `` milking '' the situation .
@ twitterid are you bullsing us ?
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: haystack blaze in bedfordshire
text: firefighters have tackled a haystack blaze in a bedfordshire field overnight .
they were called at 21:50 to london lane in houghton conquest where 50 tonnes of baled straw was alight and were at the scene until 09:00 this morning .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: officers moo-ve in to herd hertfordshire cows
text: forty cows have been herded back into their field in hertfordshire by police after breaking out and roaming the roads .
the cows wandered out of their field between walkern and benington earlier after a panel of fencing was broken .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: sam gallagher joins mk dons
text: championship side mk dons have signed southampton forward sam gallagher
the 19-year-old came through the saints youth system , and has scored twice in 20 senior appearances for the premier league club .
`` from the moment i got here , i 've been made to feel really welcome - to feel wanted by someone like ( boss ) karl robinson and to be at this kind of club gives me a real boost , '' he said .
author: Phil Shepka
BBC Sport

documents.title: if you 're catching up this lunchtime
text: the top stories so far today :
author: Jane Killick
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: long delays on roads and trains
text: there are queues for 11 miles on the m1 northbound due to accident investigation work at j14 .
one lane is closed and traffic is back to j12 .
as a result of the m1 traffic , the a5 northbound is busy between the caddington turn-off in dunstable and hockliffe .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: high wycombe burst main : thames water 'working flat out '
text: earlier we told you about a water main that had burst in kingsmead road in high wycombe overnight .

thames water have told me a section of the road is closed between high wycombe rugby club and the junction with dolphin court while teams clean up the area - but water supplies in the area remain normal and are not expected to be interrupted by repair work .
it said 12 properties were affected by water when a pipe burst in a wooded area to the north of the road , washing silt and debris down onto the street .
the company said it was `` working flat out '' to clear the silt and get the road re-opened as soon as possible .
author: Katy Lewis
Beds, Herts and Bucks Live

documents.title: will battle : your comments
text: the `` will debate '' is still bubbling along after yesterday 's media coverage about a
on
lauren
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: west coast mainline delays : lines re-open
text: london midland trains
# leightonbuzzard update 17 : all lines are now open and services are calling at # leightonbuzzard .
please still expect delays

documents.title: residual delays on trains from mk
text: train services between milton keynes and london are still being delayed this morning , after a person was hit by a train at leighton buzzard .
network rail say the incident happened at 6.40 ; disruption is expected to continue until at least midday .
virgin , london midland and southern services are affected , although all lines have now reopened .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: alley urinators face 'pptv ' shame
text: hertfordshire police has said it will

the force said residents near west alley have had to suffer people using the area to go to the toilet and various other forms of anti-social behaviour in the last year and it hopes the prospect of being identified will `` deter people from behaving in an offensive way '' .
a cctv image of a teenager fined after he was caught urinating there in the early hours of 10 july has been released with his face blurred ( but a spokesman said future images will not be obscured .
it said patrols have been stepped up and anyone caught will be issued with a fine of up to £ 60 .
author: Katy Lewis
Beds, Herts and Bucks Live

documents.title: bucks truck driver stuck on m20
text: a man from buckinghamshire travelling to belgium for work has spent the night waiting to cross the channel .
vince steptoe has been in the same place for over 12 hours - just past j10 for ashford on the m20 .
he left high wycombe at 04:30 yesterday for the journey to belgium , which normally takes him 20 hours .
but he 's not even made it out of the uk in 31 hours .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: delays on m1 in bucks
text: there are delays on the m1 in buckinghamshire after a five vehicle crash earlier this morning about half-a-mile before the exit for junction 14 .
the air ambulance was called after a collision involving a lorry and four cars , just before 08:00 on the northbound carriageway .
there are delays across the region , with police investigations continuing on the motorway itself .
get the latest news on the queues
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: luton town hall clock silenced
text: the chimes of the clock at luton town hall , which have rung with no major interruptions since 1936 , will be silent for a few months while it receives a major overhaul .

they were stopped on monday to enable specialist contractors to work safely while refurbishing and replacing parts of the clock mechanism , much of which dates back almost 80 years , along with cleaning the 144ft high tower .
the project is expected to last until late october and cost about £ 120,000 .
author: Katy Lewis
Beds, Herts and Bucks Live

documents.title: train pushed to broxbourne
text: a greater anglia train heading in to london has been pushed to broxbourne after being broken down with no power for more than an hour .
trains are running well towards stansted airport so there does n't seem to be any problems with passengers catching flights .
there are delays of up to 90 minutes between the capital and cambridge/bishops stortford .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: the news so far this morning
text: the top stories we 're looking at :
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

text: greater anglia
they also

disruption is expected until 12:00 .

documents.title: stansted express train stuck outside broxbourne
text: a stansted express train has been stuck outside broxbourne for about an hour with no power .
passengers on the train are being told the train will be pushed to broxbourne .
they can see trains passing freely in the other direction .
joanne bassett has said the train is `` so hot '' as there is no air conditioning .
she also said the `` train was already short formed we are told due to an earlier train fault '' .
author: Dani Bailey
Beds, Herts & Bucks Live

documents.title: hunt for missing lilley teenager
text: police need your help to find a teenager who has
author: Hertfordshire Mercury

documents.title: burst water main in high wycombe
text: firefighters used sandbags and water booms to protect homes from flooding after a water main burst in high wycombe last night .
crews were called to kingsmead road just before midnight .
the incident is now in the hands of thames water and buckinghamshire county council - we 'll bring you more on this story as soon as we get it .
author: Katy Lewis
Beds, Herts and Bucks Live

documents.title: m1 accident update
text: the m1 at j14 for milton keynes was closed in both directions earlier so the air ambulance could land following an accident involving three cars .
highways england said the southbound carriageway has now re-opened and one lane is open northbound but there are long delays in the area and on the approaches .
author: Katy Lewis
Beds, Herts and Bucks Live

documents.title: watford residents complain about flooding
text: people living in a block of flats in watford say they their lives are being ruined by water flooding the building .

residents of attenborough court claim they have received little help from their housing association despite the building flooding regularly since it was built in 2012 and some have been forced to move into a hotel following last thursday 's thunderstorms .

origin housing said : `` we acquired the site from developers and our development team have been liaising with the contractors and developers of the site to find a solution we realise that we have n't updated residents as much as we should have done on what we 've been doing to remedy the situation . ''
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: west coast mainline update
text: earlier we told you that emergency services are dealing with an incident between bletchley and leighton buzzard on the west coast mainline which is causing disruption to train services between london euston and milton keynes .
author: Katy Lewis
Beds, Herts and Bucks Live

documents.title: travel update : accident on the m1
text: the m1 is blocked northbound at j14 for milton keynes due to an accident involving three cars .
congestion is back to j13 for the a421 for bedford .
on the opposite carriageway , traffic is queuing for three miles as drivers slow down .
get the latest updates from
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: bedfordshire police overtime bill up by 50 %
text: bedfordshire police force 's overtime bill has gone up by 50 % in the last three years - explained in part by gaps in recruitment .
the figures were obtained by a bbc radio 5 live
the home office said the government had `` already taken steps to reduce unnecessary overtime payments '' .
we hope to hear from bedfordshire police later .
author: BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: today 's weather : cool with rain on the way
text: it will be a rather cool day for the time of year today , looking dry and sunny this morning , but with heavy showers forecast for this afternoon .
maximum temperature : 19c ( 66f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: duke of kent to visit bletchley park
text: the story of the codebreakers of world war one is being celebrated during a royal visit to bletchley park today .
the duke of kent will meet relatives of some of those highlighted in the exhibition .
author: Katy Lewis
Beds, Herts and Bucks Live

documents.title: the news so far today
text: here are the top stories we 're looking at this morning :
author: Simon Oxley
BBC Three Counties Radio

documents.title: travel update : west coast mainline delays
text: train services between milton keynes and london are being delayed by up to an hour this morning , after a person was hit by a train between bletchley and leighton buzzard .
network rail say disruption is expected to continue until about 09:00 .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to today 's live page for bedfordshire , hertfordshire and buckinghamshire , where we 'll bring you all the latest news , sport , leisure , travel and weather stories from across the three counties until 18:00 .
we 'd love you to be part of this page so feel free to email your comments to
author: Katy Lewis
Beds, Herts and Bucks Live
